title: Beef Taco Noodle Casserole
ingredients: 6 ounces dry extra-wide egg noodles, uncooked
2 cups frozen Southwest mixed vegetables (corn, black beans, red peppers)
1 (10 ounce) can Diced Tomatoes & Green Chilies, undrained
1 ¼ cups shredded Mexican blend cheese
¼ cup thinly sliced green onions
method: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray 13x9-inch glass baking dish with cooking spray. Place uncooked noodles in baking dish.

Step 2: Heat large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef; cook 5 to 7 minutes or until crumbled and no longer pink. Drain. Add vegetables, undrained tomatoes, enchilada sauce, and water to skillet; stir. Bring to a boil. Pour mixture over noodles.

Step 3: Cover dish tightly with foil; bake 15 minutes. Stir; sprinkle with cheese and cover with foil. Bake 10 minutes more or until noodles are tender. Sprinkle with green onions. Serve with sour cream, if desired.
